application

Class FPSSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.FPSSystem

  • public class FPSSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    An fps system for use with OpenGL applications. Requires GL2 capabilities.
    Author:
    Sam Dark

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double fps
      The current fps
      private int framesSinceLast
      How many frames there have been since the last fps update
      private double frameTime
      The time it took to render the current frame (1/fps)
      private long lastTime
      The time the fps was last updated
      private double readableFPS
      The current fps in readable form (less decimal places)
      private double readableFrameTime
      The time it took to render the current frame in readable form (less decimal places)
      private long startTime
      The time the fps system was started
      private long updateLength
      The length of time between fps updates in ms

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FPSSystem()
      Creates and starts an fps system with the default 500ms update length
      FPSSystem(long inpUpdateLength)
      Creates and starts an FPSSystem with a custom update length

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFrame()
      Increases the number of frames since the last fps update.
      void checkFPS()
      Updates the FPS number based on the time since the last update and the number of frames since then
      void displayString(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable, javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu, java.lang.String inp, int inpX, int inpY)
      Displays a given string to a given position
      double getFPS()
      Gets the current average fps number
      private void init()
      Initialises the FPSSystem.
      void showFPS(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable, javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu)
      Draws the fps and frame time to the screen.
      void showFPSAndVerts(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable, javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu, int noVerts)
      Draws the fps, frame time and number of vertices to the screen.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        The time it took to render the current frame in readable form (less decimal places)

        The time the fps was last updated

    • Constructor Detail

      • FPSSystem

        FPSSystem()
        Creates and starts an fps system with the default 500ms update length

      • FPSSystem

        FPSSystem(long inpUpdateLength)
        Creates and starts an FPSSystem with a custom update length
        Parameters:
        inpUpdateLength - The custom update length in ms

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()
        Initialises the FPSSystem. Must be called when created or the FPSSystem will not function correctly

      • checkFPS

        public void checkFPS()
        Updates the FPS number based on the time since the last update and the number of frames since then

      • showFPSAndVerts

        public void showFPSAndVerts(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable,
                            javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu,
                            int noVerts)
        Draws the fps, frame time and number of vertices to the screen. Requires openGL2 capabilities and GLU for orthogonal projection.
        Parameters:
        drawable - The drawable GLAutoDrawable object to draw to.
        glu - The GLU to use for orthogonal projection
        noVerts - The number of vertices it is displaying (easier if this is shown with fps).

      • showFPS

        public void showFPS(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable,
                    javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu)
        Draws the fps and frame time to the screen. Requires openGL2 capabilities and GLU for orthogonal projection.
        Parameters:
        drawable - The drawable GLAutoDrawable object to draw to.
        glu - The GLU to use for orthogonal projection

      • displayString

        public void displayString(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable,
                          javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu,
                          java.lang.String inp,
                          int inpX,
                          int inpY)
        Displays a given string to a given position
        Parameters:
        inp - The string to display
        drawable - The drawable GLAutoDrawable object to draw to.
        glu - The GLU to use for orthogonal projection
        inpX - The x position on the screen to display to
        inpY - The y position on the screen to display to

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame()
        Increases the number of frames since the last fps update. Should be called with every draw to the screen.

      • getFPS

        public double getFPS()
        Gets the current average fps number
        Returns:
        The current fps
